members.name: baseUrl
contractHash

members.docComment:
/**
 * Creates a client-side interpreter that proxies all operations to a server.
 *
 * Each handler evaluates its RuntimeEntry children via yield, then sends the resolved data to `{baseUrl}/mvfm/execute` as a JSON POST.
 *
 * @param options - Handler options.
 *
 * @param nodeKinds - Node kinds to create handlers for.
 *
 * @returns An Interpreter that proxies all operations to the server.
 */
members.name: clientInterpreter

members.docComment:
/**
 * Creates a base interpreter for `postgres/*` node kinds.
 *
 * Handles query, identifier, insert_helper, and set_helper nodes. For begin, savepoint, and cursor, use createPostgresServerInterpreter.
 *
 * @param client - The {@link PostgresClient} to execute against.
 *
 * @returns An Interpreter handling postgres node kinds.
 */
members.name: createPostgresInterpreter

members.docComment:
/**
 * Creates a full server-side interpreter for `postgres/*` node kinds, including transaction, savepoint, and cursor support.
 *
 * Uses a closure-scoped client stack so that queries inside transactions automatically use the transaction client. No adjacency map or base interpreter required â€” all child evaluation uses generator yields.
 *
 * @param client - The {@link PostgresClient} to execute against.
 *
 * @returns An Interpreter for all postgres node kinds.
 */
members.name: createPostgresServerInterpreter

members.docComment:
/**
 * Creates the postgres plugin definition (unified Plugin type).
 *
 * This plugin has NO defaultInterpreter. You must provide one via `defaults(plugins, { postgres: createPostgresServerInterpreter(...) })`.
 *
 * @param config - A connection string or {@link PostgresConfig} object. Config is captured by the interpreter, not stored on AST nodes.
 *
 * @returns A unified Plugin that contributes `$.sql`.
 */
members.name: postgres

members.docComment:
/**
 * Database client interface consumed by the postgres handler.
 *
 * Abstracts over the actual database driver so handlers can be tested with mock clients.
 */
members.name: PostgresClient

members.docComment:
/**
 * Connection configuration for the postgres plugin.
 *
 * Accepts the same options as postgres.js: connection string or individual host/port/database/username/password fields, plus SSL, connection pool size, and column name transforms.
 */
members.name: PostgresConfig

members.docComment:
/**
 * Database operations added to the DSL context by the postgres plugin.
 *
 * Mirrors the postgres.js (porsager/postgres) v3.4.x API as closely as possible: tagged template queries, dynamic identifiers, insert/set helpers, transactions, savepoints, and cursors.
 */
members.name: PostgresMethods
sql
postgresPlugin
PostgresSql
PostgresTxSql

members.docComment:
/**
 * Wraps a `postgres` (v3.4.x) SQL client into a {@link PostgresClient}.
 *
 * @param sql - A postgres-js SQL tagged template function.
 *
 * @returns A {@link PostgresClient} adapter.
 */
members.name: wrapPostgresJs
